# rlp.cr

[![Build Status](https://img.shields.io/github/workflow/status/q9f/rlp.cr/Nightly)](https://github.com/q9f/rlp.cr/actions)
[![Documentation](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs-html-black)](https://q9f.github.io/rlp.cr/)
[![Release](https://img.shields.io/github/v/release/q9f/rlp.cr?include_prereleases&color=black)](https://github.com/q9f/rlp.cr/releases/latest)
[![Language](https://img.shields.io/github/languages/top/q9f/rlp.cr?color=black)](https://github.com/q9f/rlp.cr/search?l=crystal)
[![License](https://img.shields.io/github/license/q9f/rlp.cr.svg?color=black)](LICENSE)

a native library implementing `rlp` purely for the crystal language. `rlp` is ethereum's recursive length prefix used to encode arbitray data structures.

this library allows for rlp-encoding of:
* binary data (assumed encoded)
* boolean values (true, false)
* scalars (positive integers)
* string literals and characters
* arrays containing any of the the above
* nested arrays containing any of the above

this library allows for decoding of:
* rlp-encoded data in binary format
* rlp-encoded data in hexadecimal string format

note, that decoded data is always binary as per ethereum's design rationale:

> _"RLP does not attempt to define any specific data types such as booleans, floats, doubles or even integers; instead, it simply exists to store structure, in the form of nested arrays, and leaves it up to the protocol to determine the meaning of the arrays"_

# installation

add the `rlp` library to your `shard.yml`

```yaml
dependencies:
  rlp:
    github: q9f/rlp.cr
    version: "~> 0.1"
```

# usage

```crystal
# import rlp
require "rlp"
```

this library exposes the following modules (in logical order):

* `Rlp`: core library exposing `encode` and `decode` logic
* `Rlp::Util`: a collection of utilities to ease the conversion between data types
* `Rlp::RecursiveArray`: is a data type alias allowing for arrays of unknown nesting depth

basic usage:

```crystal
# rlp-encode a string
rlp = Rlp.encode("A cat with a short string.")
# => Bytes[154, 65, 32, 99, 97, 116, 32, 119, 105, 116, 104, 32, 97, 32, 115, 104, 111, 114, 116, 32, 115, 116, 114, 105, 110, 103, 46]

# (optionally) get a hex representation of the rlp-encoded data
hex = Rlp::Util.bin_to_hex rlp
# => "9a4120636174207769746820612073686f727420737472696e672e"

# decode the rlp data
bin = Rlp.decode hex
# => Bytes[65, 32, 99, 97, 116, 32, 119, 105, 116, 104, 32, 97, 32, 115, 104, 111, 114, 116, 32, 115, 116, 114, 105, 110, 103, 46]

# we expect a string, so we can try to convert it here
str = Rlp::Util.bin_to_str bin
# => "A cat with a short string."
```

# documentation

generate a local copy with:

```
crystal docs
```

# testing

the library is entirely specified through tests in `./spec`; run:

```bash
crystal spec --verbose
```

# contribute

create a pull request, and make sure tests and linter passes.

this library with built with the help of the blog post by the mana team implementing [`rlp` in elixir](https://www.badykov.com/elixir/2018/05/06/rlp/) and coinmonks' [annotated version of the `rlp` specification](https://medium.com/coinmonks/data-structure-in-ethereum-episode-1-recursive-length-prefix-rlp-encoding-decoding-d1016832f919). ethereum classic's [`rlp` article](https://ethereumclassic.org/blog/2018-03-19-rlp/) allows for some sweet test cases.

contributors: [**@q9f**](https://github.com/q9f/)

constants.name: EMPTY_ARRAY
constants.doc: An empty array is defined as `0xC0`.

constants.name: EMPTY_STRING
constants.doc: An empty string is defined as `0x80`.

constants.name: LIMIT_LONG
constants.doc: The size limit of large data objects to be encoded is `256 ** 8`.
constants.summary: The size limit of large data objects to be encoded is 256 ** 8.

constants.name: LIMIT_SHORT
constants.doc: The size limit of small data objects to be encoded is `56`.
constants.summary: The size limit of small data objects to be encoded is 56.

constants.name: OFFSET_ARRAY
constants.doc: The offset for array list encoding is `192`.
constants.summary: The offset for array list encoding is 192.

constants.name: OFFSET_STRING
constants.doc: The offset for string literal encoding is `128`.
constants.summary: The offset for string literal encoding is 128.

constants.doc: The version of the `Rlp` module shard.
constants.summary: The version of the Rlp module shard.

The `Rlp` module implementing Ethereum's Recursive Length Prefix
for arbitrary data encoding and decoding.

class_methods.name: decode
class_methods.doc:
decodes arbitrary data from a recursive length prefix blob.
note, that the returned data only restores the data structure.
it's up to the protocol to determine the meaning of the data
as defined in ethereum's design rationale.
class_methods.summary: decodes arbitrary data from a recursive length prefix blob.

def.name: decode
def.body:
if rlp === EMPTY_STRING
  return ""
else
  if rlp === EMPTY_ARRAY
    return [] of RecursiveArray
  end
end
prefix = rlp.first
length = rlp.bytesize
if prefix < OFFSET_STRING && (length === 1)
  return rlp
else
  if prefix < (OFFSET_STRING + LIMIT_SHORT)
    offset = 1
    return rlp[offset, length - offset]
  else
    if prefix < OFFSET_ARRAY
      offset = (1 + prefix) - 183
      return rlp[offset, length - offset]
    else
      result = [] of RecursiveArray
      if prefix < (OFFSET_ARRAY + LIMIT_SHORT)
        offset = 1
        rlp = rlp[offset, length - offset]
      else
        offset = (1 + prefix) - 247
        rlp = rlp[offset, length - offset]
      end
      while rlp.bytesize > 0
        prefix = rlp.first
        length = 0
        if prefix < OFFSET_STRING
          length = 1
        else
          if prefix < (OFFSET_STRING + LIMIT_SHORT)
            length = (1 + prefix) - OFFSET_STRING
          else
            if prefix < OFFSET_ARRAY
              header_size = prefix - 183
              header = rlp[1, header_size]
              length = (1 + header_size) + (Util.bin_to_int(header))
            else
              if prefix < (OFFSET_ARRAY + LIMIT_SHORT)
                length = (1 + prefix) - OFFSET_ARRAY
              else
                header_size = prefix - 247
                header = rlp[1, header_size]
                length = (1 + header_size) + (Util.bin_to_int(header))
              end
            end
          end
        end
        result << (decode(rlp[0, length]))
        offset = length
        length = rlp.size - length
        rlp = rlp[offset, length]
      end
      return result
    end
  end
end

class_methods.name: decode
class_methods.doc: decodes rlp data from hex-encoded strings

def.name: decode
def.body: return decode(Util.hex_to_bin(hex))

class_methods.name: encode
class_methods.doc: rlp-encodes binary data

def.name: encode
def.body:
if (b.bytesize === 1) && b.first < OFFSET_STRING
  return b
end
if b.bytesize < LIMIT_SHORT
  prefix = UInt8.new(b.bytesize + OFFSET_STRING)
  p = Bytes[prefix]
  return Util.binary_add(p, b)
end
if b.bytesize < LIMIT_LONG
  data_size = b.bytesize
  header = Util.int_to_bin(data_size)
  prefix = UInt8.new(((header.bytesize + OFFSET_STRING) + LIMIT_SHORT) - 1)
  p = Bytes[prefix]
  header = Util.binary_add(p, header)
  return Util.binary_add(header, b)
else
  raise("invalid data provided (size out of range: #{b.bytesize})")
end

class_methods.name: encode
class_methods.doc: rlp-encodes lists data

def.name: encode
def.body:
if l.empty?
  return EMPTY_ARRAY
end
body = Slice(UInt8).empty
l.each do |a|
  if body.size === 0
    body = encode(a)
  else
    body = Util.binary_add(body, encode(a))
  end
end
if body.bytesize < LIMIT_SHORT
  prefix = UInt8.new(body.bytesize + OFFSET_ARRAY)
  p = Bytes[prefix]
  return Util.binary_add(p, body)
end
if body.bytesize < LIMIT_LONG
  data_size = body.bytesize
  header = Util.int_to_bin(data_size)
  prefix = UInt8.new(((header.bytesize + OFFSET_ARRAY) + LIMIT_SHORT) - 1)
  p = Bytes[prefix]
  header = Util.binary_add(p, header)
  return Util.binary_add(header, body)
else
  raise("invalid list provided (size out of range: #{body.bytesize})")
end

class_methods.name: encode
class_methods.doc: rlp-encodes string data

def.name: encode
def.body:
if s.empty?
  return EMPTY_STRING
else
  if s.size < LIMIT_LONG
    return encode(Util.str_to_bin(s))
  else
    raise("invalid string provided (size out of range: #{s.size})")
  end
end

class_methods.name: encode
class_methods.doc: rlp-encodes scalar data

def.name: encode
def.body:
if i === 0
  return EMPTY_STRING
else
  if i > 0 && i < LIMIT_LONG
    return encode(Util.int_to_bin(i))
  else
    raise("invalid scalar provided (out of range: #{i})")
  end
end

class_methods.name: encode
class_methods.doc: rlp-encodes characters

def.name: encode
def.body: return encode(c.to_s)

class_methods.name: encode
class_methods.doc: rlp-encodes boolean data

def.name: encode
def.body:
if o
  return Bytes[1]
else
  return EMPTY_STRING
end

class_methods.name: bin_to_hex
class_methods.doc:
Converts binary bytes to a hex-encoded string.

Parameters:
* `b` (`Bytes`): the binary bytes data to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.bin_to_hex Bytes[4, 200, 29])
# => "04c81d"
```
class_methods.summary: Converts binary bytes to a hex-encoded string.

def.name: bin_to_hex
def.body:
h = b.hexstring
if h.size.odd?
  h = "0#{h}"
end
return h

class_methods.name: bin_to_int
class_methods.doc:
Converts binary bytes to a big integer.

Parameters:
* `b` (`Bytes`): the binary bytes data to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.bin_to_int Bytes[15, 66, 64])
# => 1000000
```
class_methods.summary: Converts binary bytes to a big integer.

def.name: bin_to_int
def.body: return BigInt.new(b.hexstring, 16)

class_methods.name: bin_to_int
class_methods.doc:
Overloaded function `bin_to_int` with `String` to allow for conversion of
decoded `Rlp` objects that might be a string already.

Parameters:
* `s` (`String`): the `Rlp` string data to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.bin_to_int ""
# => 128
```

Note, that the only `String` that `Rlp.decode` actually returns is `""`.

Raises if `s` actually contains a string. Should use `hex_to_int` instead.
class_methods.summary: Overloaded function .bin_to_int with String to allow for conversion of decoded Rlp objects that might be a string already.

def.name: bin_to_int
def.body:
if s.size === 0
  return 128
end
raise("cannot convert string literals to numbers, did you mean `hex_to_int`?")

class_methods.name: bin_to_int
class_methods.doc:
Overloaded function `bin_to_int` with `Array` to allow for conversion of
decoded `Rlp` objects that might be an `RecursiveArray`.

Raises in any case if `a` actually contains an array. Shouldn't be used
if decoded `Rlp` data could contain nested data structures.
class_methods.summary: Overloaded function .bin_to_int with Array to allow for conversion of decoded Rlp objects that might be an RecursiveArray.

def.name: bin_to_int
def.body: raise("cannot convert array data to numbers, please unpack first")

class_methods.name: binary_add
class_methods.doc: concatenates two byte slices of uint8

def.name: binary_add
def.body:
c = IO::Memory.new(a.bytesize + b.bytesize)
a.each do |v|
  c.write_bytes(UInt8.new(v))
end
b.each do |v|
  c.write_bytes(UInt8.new(v))
end
return c.to_slice

class_methods.name: hex_to_bin
class_methods.doc:
Converts hex-encoded strings to binary bytes data.

Parameters:
* `h` (`String`): the hex-encoded string to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.hex_to_bin "04c81d"
# => Bytes[4, 200, 29]
```
class_methods.summary: Converts hex-encoded strings to binary bytes data.

def.name: hex_to_bin
def.body:
if h.size.odd?
  h = "0#{h}"
end
return h.hexbytes

class_methods.name: hex_to_int
class_methods.doc:
Converts hex-encoded strings to big integers.

Parameters:
* `h` (`String`): the hex-encoded string to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.hex_to_int "04c81d"
# => 313373
```

def.name: hex_to_int
def.body:
if h.size.odd?
  h = "0#{h}"
end
return BigInt.new(h, 16)

class_methods.name: hex_to_str
class_methods.doc:
Converts hex-encoded strings to string literals.

Parameters:
* `h` (`String`): the hex-encoded string to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.hex_to_str "646f67"
# => "dog"
```

def.name: hex_to_str
def.body:
if h.size.odd?
  h = "0#{h}"
end
return String.new(h.hexbytes)

class_methods.name: int_to_bin
class_methods.doc:
Converts big integers to binary bytes.

Parameters:
* `i` (`Int`): the big integer to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.int_to_bin 1_000_000
# => Bytes[15, 66, 64]
```

def.name: int_to_bin
def.body:
h = i.to_s(16)
if h.size.odd?
  h = "0#{h}"
end
return h.hexbytes

class_methods.name: str_to_hex
class_methods.doc:
Converts string literals to hex-encoded strings.

Parameters:
* `s` (`String`): the string literal to convert.

```
Rlp::Util.str_to_hex "dog"
# => "646f67"
```
